name: Shishi: Ballad of the Oracle
description:
It's about time!


Shishi: Ballad of the Oracle is a single-player role-playing game, with gameplay that is accessible to everyone. After failing to save the world many times, an Oracle named Elia must regain self-confidence to save alternative timelines where there is still hope. She will have to travel across land and sea to fulfill her quest.

To regain her confidence, she will need to overcome many challenges while trying to awaken her true power. But she won't be alone, she will meet Ethan, who is a dear friend and great warrior. The two heroes will team up to face many dangers as the world comes to an end...

Features


  • Explore dungeons full of secrets
  • Fight enemies in turn-based battles
  • Solve puzzles between alternate timelines
  • Accessible gameplay in a world that adapts to the player

Explore alternate timelines


While exploring the world, you will need to solve puzzles to proceed in your quest. Sometimes, the clue may be hidden in an alternate timeline. Thanks to her Oracle vision, Elia can see through those timelines and unveil new paths. This power will be essential to solve puzzles and find treasures.

Fight cute and dangerous creatures!


The battles are made to be simple and fast to prevent breaking the flow of the exploration. Also, it makes it easy to understand for newcomers to the genre. When facing an enemy, you can either attack with your main weapon or use any equipped Magic or Item. As you become more powerful, you’ll unlock special moves and even more!

During her quest, Elia will meet strong opponents called Guardians. If they're impressed by her strength, she will be able to summon them in battles when she needs help. However, fighting them won't be easy, you may fail many times, so you will have to get good!

Everyone can play!


The game offers an open world that adapts to the player. Indeed, the different parts of the scenario do not need to be played in a specific order. The difficulty of fighting therefore varies according to two factors, the progression in the main quest and the player’s ability to face the enemies.

To make sure everyone can play, the game features customizable controls and interface. It includes native support for the Xbox Adaptive Controller, one-handed mode and visual options for visually impaired players like high contrast and colorblind modes.
